definition: roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve

sentences.english: What we are witnessing might in the end be on a par with the swift and sudden collapse of the communist dictatorships of Eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 而最后等待我们的是政权的迅速瓦解，其状必如东欧。

sentences.english: They want to breake our will to resist by various promises and assurances.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望利用五花八门的许诺和保证瓦解我们的抵抗。

sentences.english: And Russia is making up for past humiliations after the collapse of the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯在洗刷前苏联瓦解之后所蒙受的屈辱。

sentences.english: By 180 AD, the Roman Empire began to disintegrate.
sentences.chinese: 到了公元180年，罗马帝国开始瓦解。

sentences.english: The army paralyzed the enemy's fighting will.
sentences.chinese: 部队瓦解了敌军的斗志。

sentences.english: The Anfield club face the possibility that a long, drawn-out dispute could disrupt their season.
sentences.chinese: 安菲尔德的球队面临赛季被冗长的争论瓦解的可能。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, it might all come crashing down. But Kevin did not really care.
sentences.chinese: 早早晚晚，这种生活会土崩瓦解，可凯文并布在乎。

sentences.english: Nanzhao itself collapsed from internecine warfare shortly after the Tang Dynasty fell.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝灭亡不久，南昭国因内乱也开始崩溃瓦解。

sentences.english: The electrocute and disintegrate videos show it pretty well.
sentences.chinese: 瓦解之光和电刑的动画很好的显示了这一点。

sentences.english: The rights structure of competing xians cannot be easily demolished.
sentences.chinese: 互相竞争的县的权利结构不容易瓦解。

sentences.english: But the walls that have guarded this document-based world are crumbling fast.
sentences.chinese: 但是保护它的统治世界的墙正在迅速的瓦解。

sentences.english: Clearly, these tenets are already disintegrating in a country like Greece.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这些原则在希腊这样的国家已土崩瓦解。
老校友的关系网正在瓦解。

sentences.english: This can paralyse the enemy's fighting will.
sentences.chinese: 这可能瓦解敌军的斗志。
他们的背叛瓦解了该党。

sentences.english: The right-wing group had already been poleaxed mentally and emotionally.
sentences.chinese: 右翼团体已经从思想和感情上被分散瓦解了。

definition: to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
